questions.questionText: With an M1 license, when are you allowed to drive?

options.text: Only during daylight hours — one-half hour before sunrise to one-half hour after sunset

questions.questionText: If you have a Class M2 (M) licence, are you able to drive a two-wheeled motorcycle, limited-speed motorcycle, or moped?
Driving for long periods in cold weather can cause...?
What is the minimum age to drive a motorcycle in Ontario?
Once you pass the vision and knowledge tests, you get a Class M1 license and enter Level One. You must stay at Level One for a minimum of...?
If you pass the test on a three-wheeled motorcycle, you get an M (M) licence, which allows you to drive...?
Are you allowed to carry passengers with an M1 license?
If you have a valid Class M2, M2(L), or M2(M) licence, you may also drive Class G vehicles under the conditions that apply to...?
Which statement is FALSE? Consider wearing protective equipment such as...?
What is the most common cause of traffic collisions?
Before taking the Level Two test on a motorcycle that is not limited-speed, you must complete a declaration of...?
A ministry-approved motorcycle safety course has a course certificate valid for...?
The M1 license is only valid for how many days?
How should a helmet feel once you put it on?
What should happen when you release the throttle?

options.text: It should spring back completely to the idle position
It should remain in the same position

questions.questionText: Choose boots that are sturdy and...?

options.text: High enough to protect your ankles

questions.questionText: If you pass a ministry-approved motorcycle safety course, you can reduce the time spent at Level Two by how much?
What will make you more visible to other drivers on the road?
Which statement is FALSE? Gauntlet gloves that extend over your wrists are recommended because they protect your...?
The rear brake lever is...
You may stay at Level Two for a maximum of how long from the day you pass your Level One road test?
How many road tests must you pass to gain a full motorcycle license?
At level two, are you allowed to drive at night?
Level Two lasts a minimum of how many months from the day you obtain your M2 or M2 (L), or M2 (M) license?
If you pass the road test on a motorcycle that is not three-wheeled or limited-speed, you get which type of license?
The shift lever should only be used when...?
How many types of vehicles for which you require a motorcycle class license to drive on public roads in Ontario?
How long does the entire Graduated Licensing System last in Ontario?
Will a driver have their Class M licence restricted to the type of vehicle they bring to the road test?
The clutch lever is on...?
The high-beam light glows what colour when the high beam headlight is on?
Should you always check the condition of the vehicle before you drive it?
Do the headlight and tail light come on automatically when the ignition is switched on and the engine is running?

options.text: Only if you add this as a feature

questions.questionText: Which statement is FALSE? Check your tires for the following...?
Begin by making sure your vehicle is not too heavy or large for you to drive comfortably. Sitting on the seat, you should be able to place your feet...?

options.text: On the ground after tilting the motorcycle

questions.questionText: Some motorcycles have a kick-start lever located...?
Which statement is FALSE? When checking cables, you should check...?
To shift up, twist the throttle as you...?
Make sure all levers, pedals and switches are in good condition, operate properly, and...?

options.text: Ease forward when you let go
Maintained in the released position when you let go
Spring back to the original position when you let go

questions.questionText: How much stopping power does the front brake provide?
Where is a centre stand usually located?

options.text: At the rear of the motorcycle
Underneath the centre of the frame

questions.questionText: When do you release the electric starter button?

options.text: Once the motorcycle begins to move
As soon as you hear the engine fire
Once you feel pressure from the clutch lever

questions.questionText: The switch to turn the headlight from low beam to high beam is usually on...?
When checking the chassis, what should you look for?
When is the choke used?

options.text: To help shut off the engine
To help start a cold engine

questions.questionText: To start, make sure your motorcycle is in which gear?

options.text: It doesn't matter as long as the brake is applied

questions.questionText: How do you pull the front brake lever smoothly?

options.text: Anyway that gets the job done

questions.questionText: Most modern limited-speed motorcycles have a type of automatic transmission called...?
To maintain your balance, keep your feet...?

options.text: Right foot ahead of the brake

questions.questionText: How should you hold the handlebars to keep you from increasing your speed by mistake?
'Push' steering will cause the motorcycle, and you, to do what?

options.text: Lean in the opposite direction you wish to turn
Lean in the direction you wish to turn

questions.questionText: What is another phrase for 'push' steering?
The engine kill switch is used...?

options.text: In an emergency to stop the engine quickly

questions.questionText: Why should you not shift gears while you are turning?

options.text: It may cause a sudden decrease in power

questions.questionText: If you do not apply enough throttle, what can the motorcycle do when you release the clutch?
The fuel supply may be controlled by what?
How do you manually switch off the signal after each turn or lane change?
Do you need to lean while turning?
How should you adjust the mirrors?

options.text: You should see the lane behind you and as much of the other lanes on the road as possible
You should not see any part of your body
You should see a small part of your rear wheel

questions.questionText: Generally, you start a motorcycle (not a limited-speed motorcycle) by turning the ignition switch on and making sure the engine kill switch is...?
If behind a large vehicle, where should you stop?

options.text: Where the driver is still able to see you in the driver-side mirror
As close to the shoulder as possible to provide an escape route

questions.questionText: Do you need to wear brightly coloured clothing and a helmet in the daytime?
Do you need to signal whenever you change lanes whether someone else is around or not?

options.text: In bright conditions such as when there is glare

questions.questionText: Should you apply both front and rear brakes every time you slow down or stop?
Why should you look beyond the vehicle in front of you?

options.text: For others that are stopping or turning ahead

questions.questionText: Which statement is FALSE? If your motorcycle or moped has a centre stand, follow these steps to park it...

options.text: Stand beside the right side of the motorcycle or moped and hold onto both handgrips
Balance the vehicle upright and use one hand to grasp the frame under the saddle
Using your right foot, lower the centre stand until you feel it touch the ground
With your right foot securely placed on the centre stand, push down and back on the stand with your foot while pulling the motorcycle back with your arms

questions.questionText: Should you always turn your head and check over your shoulder before you turn or change lanes?
Why should you approach intersections slowly?

options.text: You won't blend into the background as easily
You can make a quick stop or a quick turn
The others can spot you easier

questions.questionText: Why is it dangerous to forget to turn a signal off as it is to forget to turn it on?

options.text: A driver may think that you plan to turn or make a lane change
No one will believe any other time you signal

questions.questionText: Which statement is FALSE? It is especially important to check your mirrors in the following situations...

options.text: Before you have to slow down or stop suddenly or when you are stopped at an intersection

questions.questionText: Why is it important to communicate with other drivers?

options.text: To make sure they see you and know what you are doing

questions.questionText: How do you know another driver can see you when you are passing them?

options.text: If you are ahead of them
You can see them in your mirror
If you can see a driver in their mirror, the driver can see you

questions.questionText: When you are parked or stopped at the side of the road and want to join traffic, why should you angle your motorcycle across the road?

options.text: To make it easier to leave
So that you can see in both directions

questions.questionText: How long should you remain in another driver's blind spot?
When you approach an intersection with a vehicle waiting to pull out, why should you move toward the centre of the road?

options.text: So that you are in the other driver's line of sight
To give yourself more escape routes

questions.questionText: Do not look at one place for more than...?
Skilled drivers have very few surprises on the road because they...?

options.text: See and understand possible problems before getting to them
Follow the lead of other drivers and riders
Listen to traffic reports before riding

questions.questionText: Why should you check the roadside?

options.text: To watch for vehicles that may leave the curb or enter from side streets or driveways
To look for your next turn

questions.questionText: Do you need to use your turn signals even when what you plan to do is obvious?

options.text: Only if you feel the other driver is too close

questions.questionText: For a vehicle on your left or an oncoming vehicle with a left-turn signal on, you should...?
When stopped, keep both brakes on and...?

options.text: Your left foot on the ground
Your right foot on the ground

questions.questionText: Should you balance at a low speed instead of coming to a complete stop?

options.text: Only if weather conditions allow for it

questions.questionText: How often should you check your mirrors?
Where do most collisions between motorcycles or mopeds and other vehicles happen?
Learn to look far ahead of where you are driving in the city, such as...?

options.text: Look one-half to one full block ahead

questions.questionText: Can you make yourself more visible by moving from one side of the lane to the other?
What should you do at a blind intersection after stopping?

options.text: Ease forward past obstructions to see if anything is coming
Never turn left across the path of oncoming traffic
Proceed forward slower than normal to allow other road users a chance to see you
Always turn right to allow you to get up to speed

questions.questionText: What should you do in a blind curve, where you cannot see all the way around?

options.text: Move to the side of the lane where you can see as much as possible of the road ahead
Plan your route to travel in a different road
Stay on the inside of the curve

questions.questionText: If your turn signals or brake lights are not working, what should you do?

options.text: Make it obvious that you're turning and slowing down
Look in the direction you want to go so others will know your intentions

questions.questionText: When braking hard, keep the motorcycle or moped...

options.text: Leaning backward as much as possible
